00044 static void downstream_pending_timeout(evutil_socket_t fd, short what, void * arg);

00046 int
00047 append_ssl_x_headers(rproxy_t * rproxy, evhtp_request_t * upstream_req) {
00048     evhtp_headers_t * headers;
00049     headers_cfg_t   * headers_cfg;
00050     x509_ext_cfg_t  * x509_ext_cfg;
00051 
00052     evhtp_ssl_t     * ssl;
00053 
00054     if (!rproxy || !upstream_req) {
00055         return -1;
00056     }
00057 
00058     if (!(ssl = upstream_req->conn->ssl)) {
00059         return 0;
00060     }
00061 
00062     if (!(headers = upstream_req->headers_in)) {
00063         return -1;
00064     }
00065 
00066     if (!(headers_cfg = rproxy->server_cfg->headers)) {
00067         return 0;
00068     }
00069 
00070     if (headers_cfg->x_ssl_subject == true) {
00071         unsigned char * subj_str;
00072 
00073         evhtp_kv_rm_and_free(headers, evhtp_kvs_find_kv(headers, "X-SSL-Subject"));
00074 
00075         if ((subj_str = ssl_subject_tostr(ssl))) {
00076             evhtp_headers_add_header(headers,
00077                                      evhtp_header_new("X-SSL-Subject", subj_str, 0, 1));
00078 
00079             free(subj_str);
00080         }
00081     }
00082 
00083     if (headers_cfg->x_ssl_issuer == true) {
00084         unsigned char * issr_str;
00085 
00086         evhtp_kv_rm_and_free(headers, evhtp_kvs_find_kv(headers, "X-SSL-Issuer"));
00087 
00088         if ((issr_str = ssl_issuer_tostr(ssl))) {
00089             evhtp_headers_add_header(headers,
00090                                      evhtp_header_new("X-SSL-Issuer", issr_str, 0, 1));
00091 
00092             free(issr_str);
00093         }
00094     }
00095 
00096     if (headers_cfg->x_ssl_notbefore == true) {
00097         unsigned char * nbf_str;
00098 
00099         evhtp_kv_rm_and_free(headers, evhtp_kvs_find_kv(headers, "X-SSL-Notbefore"));
00100 
00101         if ((nbf_str = ssl_notbefore_tostr(ssl))) {
00102             evhtp_headers_add_header(headers,
00103                                      evhtp_header_new("X-SSL-Notbefore", nbf_str, 0, 1));
00104 
00105             free(nbf_str);
00106         }
00107     }
00108 
00109     if (headers_cfg->x_ssl_notafter == true) {
00110         unsigned char * naf_str;
00111 
00112         evhtp_kv_rm_and_free(headers, evhtp_kvs_find_kv(headers, "X-SSL-Notafter"));
00113 
00114         if ((naf_str = ssl_notafter_tostr(ssl))) {
00115             evhtp_headers_add_header(headers,
00116                                      evhtp_header_new("X-SSL-Notafter", naf_str, 0, 1));
00117 
00118             free(naf_str);
00119         }
00120     }
00121 
00122     if (headers_cfg->x_ssl_serial == true) {
00123         unsigned char * ser_str;
00124 
00125         evhtp_kv_rm_and_free(headers, evhtp_kvs_find_kv(headers, "X-SSL-Serial"));
00126 
00127         if ((ser_str = ssl_serial_tostr(ssl))) {
00128             evhtp_headers_add_header(headers,
00129                                      evhtp_header_new("X-SSL-Serial", ser_str, 0, 1));
00130 
00131             free(ser_str);
00132         }
00133     }
00134 
00135     if (headers_cfg->x_ssl_cipher == true) {
00136         unsigned char * cip_str;
00137 
00138         evhtp_kv_rm_and_free(headers, evhtp_kvs_find_kv(headers, "X-SSL-Cipher"));
00139 
00140         if ((cip_str = ssl_cipher_tostr(ssl))) {
00141             evhtp_headers_add_header(headers,
00142                                      evhtp_header_new("X-SSL-Cipher", cip_str, 0, 1));
00143 
00144             free(cip_str);
00145         }
00146     }
00147 
00148     if (headers_cfg->x_ssl_certificate == true) {
00149         unsigned char * cert_str;
00150 
00151         evhtp_kv_rm_and_free(headers, evhtp_kvs_find_kv(headers, "X-SSL-Certificate"));
00152 
00153         if ((cert_str = ssl_cert_tostr(ssl))) {
00154             evhtp_headers_add_header(headers,
00155                                      evhtp_header_new("X-SSL-Certificate", cert_str, 0, 1));
00156 
00157             free(cert_str);
00158         }
00159     }
00160 
00161     TAILQ_FOREACH(x509_ext_cfg, &headers_cfg->x509_exts, next) {
00162         unsigned char * ext_str;
00163 
00164         evhtp_kv_rm_and_free(headers, evhtp_kvs_find_kv(headers, x509_ext_cfg->name));
00165 
00166         if ((ext_str = ssl_x509_ext_tostr(ssl, x509_ext_cfg->oid))) {
00167             evhtp_headers_add_header(headers,
00168                                      evhtp_header_new(x509_ext_cfg->name, ext_str, 0, 1));
00169 
00170             free(ext_str);
00171         }
00172     }
00173 
00174     return 0;
00175 } /* append_ssl_x_headers */
00176 
00177 int
00178 append_x_headers(rproxy_t * rproxy, evhtp_request_t * upstream_req) {
00179     evhtp_headers_t * headers;
00180     headers_cfg_t   * headers_cfg;
00181     char              tmp1[1024];
00182     char              tmp2[1024];
00183 
00184     if (!rproxy || !upstream_req) {
00185         return -1;
00186     }
00187 
00188     if (!(headers = upstream_req->headers_in)) {
00189         return -1;
00190     }
00191 
00192     if (!(headers_cfg = rproxy->server_cfg->headers)) {
00193         return 0;
00194     }
00195 
00196     if (headers_cfg->x_forwarded_for == true) {
00197         struct sockaddr * sa;
00198         void            * src;
00199         char            * fmt;
00200         unsigned short    port;
00201         int               sres;
00202 
00203         src = NULL;
00204         sa  = upstream_req->conn->saddr;
00205 
00206         if (sa->sa_family == AF_INET) {
00207             src  = &(((struct sockaddr_in *)sa)->sin_addr);
00208             port = ntohs(((struct sockaddr_in *)sa)->sin_port);
00209             fmt  = "%s:%hu";
00210         } else if (sa->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
00211             src  = &(((struct sockaddr_in6 *)sa)->sin6_addr);
00212             port = ntohs(((struct sockaddr_in6 *)sa)->sin6_port);
00213             fmt  = "[%s]:%hu";
00214         }
00215 
00216         if (!src || !evutil_inet_ntop(sa->sa_family, src, tmp1, sizeof(tmp1))) {
00217             return -1;
00218         }
00219 
00220         sres = snprintf(tmp2, sizeof(tmp2), fmt, tmp1, port);
00221 
00222         if (sres < 0 || sres >= sizeof(tmp2)) {
00223             return -1;
00224         }
00225 
00226         evhtp_kv_rm_and_free(headers, evhtp_kvs_find_kv(headers, "X-Forwarded-For"));
00227 
00228         evhtp_headers_add_header(headers,
00229                                  evhtp_header_new("X-Forwarded-For", tmp2, 0, 1));
00230     }
00231 
00232     if (upstream_req->conn->ssl) {
00233         if (append_ssl_x_headers(rproxy, upstream_req) < 0) {
00234             return -1;
00235         }
00236     }
00237 
00238     return 0;
00239 } /* append_x_headers */
00240 
00241 int
00242 write_header_to_evbuffer(evhtp_header_t * header, void * arg) {
00243     evbuf_t * buf;
00244 
00245     buf = arg;
00246     assert(buf != NULL);
00247 
00248     evbuffer_add(buf, header->key, header->klen);
00249     evbuffer_add(buf, ": ", 2);
00250     evbuffer_add(buf, header->val, header->vlen);
00251     evbuffer_add(buf, "\r\n", 2);
00252     return 0;
00253 }
00254 
00255 evhtp_res
00256 send_upstream_headers(evhtp_request_t * upstream_req, evhtp_headers_t * hdrs, void * arg) {
00257     /* evhtp has parsed the inital request (request + headers). From this
00258      * request generate a proper request which can be pipelined to the
00259      * downstream connection
00260      */
00261     request_t      * request;
00262     rproxy_t       * rproxy;
00263     evhtp_header_t * connection_hdr;
00264     evbuf_t        * buf;
00265     char           * query_args;
00266 
00267     assert(arg != NULL);
00268 
00269     request = arg;
00270     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00271     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00272 
00273     if (request->pending == 1) {
00274         printf("break HERE pending == 1\n");
00275         abort();
00276     }
00277 
00278     if (!request->downstream_conn->connection) {
00279         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00280                                  "[ERROR] send_upstream_headers() request->downstream_conn->connection == NULL");
00281         return EVHTP_RES_ERROR;
00282     }
00283 
00284     /* Add X-Headers to the request if applicable */
00285     if (append_x_headers(rproxy, upstream_req) < 0) {
00286         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00287                                  "[ERROR] send_upstream_headers() append_x_headers < 0");
00288         return EVHTP_RES_ERROR;
00289     }
00290 
00291     /* checks to determine of the upstream request is set to a
00292      * non keep-alive state, and if it is it magically converts
00293      * it to a keep-alive request to send to the downstream so
00294      * the connection remains open
00295      */
00296     switch (upstream_req->proto) {
00297         case EVHTP_PROTO_10:
00298             if (upstream_req->keepalive > 0) {
00299                 break;
00300             }
00301 
00302             /* upstream request is HTTP/1.0 with no keep-alive header,
00303              * to keep our connection alive to the downstream we insert
00304              * a Connection: Keep-Alive header
00305              */
00306 
00307             if ((connection_hdr = evhtp_headers_find_header(hdrs, "Connection"))) {
00308                 evhtp_header_rm_and_free(hdrs, connection_hdr);
00309             }
00310 
00311             connection_hdr = evhtp_header_new("Connection", "Keep-Alive", 0, 0);
00312 
00313             if (connection_hdr == NULL) {
00314                 logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00315                                          "[CRIT] Could not create new header! %s",
00316                                          strerror(errno));
00317                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00318             }
00319 
00320             evhtp_headers_add_header(hdrs, connection_hdr);
00321             break;
00322         case EVHTP_PROTO_11:
00323             if (upstream_req->keepalive > 0) {
00324                 break;
00325             }
00326 
00327             /* upstream request is HTTP/1.1 but the Connection: close header was
00328              * present, so just remove the header to keep downstream connection
00329              * alive.
00330              */
00331 
00332             const char * v = evhtp_kv_find(hdrs, "Connection");
00333 
00334             connection_hdr = evhtp_headers_find_header(hdrs, "Connection");
00335 
00336             if (!strcasecmp(v, "close")) {
00337                 upstream_req->keepalive = 0;
00338             }
00339 
00340             evhtp_header_rm_and_free(hdrs, connection_hdr);
00341             break;
00342         default:
00343             logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00344                                      "[ERROR] send_upstream_headers() unknown proto %d", upstream_req->proto);
00345             return EVHTP_RES_ERROR;
00346     } /* switch */
00347 
00348     if (upstream_req->uri && upstream_req->uri->query_raw) {
00349         query_args = upstream_req->uri->query_raw;
00350     } else {
00351         query_args = "";
00352     }
00353 
00354     if (*query_args == '?') {
00355         query_args++;
00356     }
00357 
00358     if (!(buf = evbuffer_new())) {
00359         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00360                                  "[CRIT] Could not create new evbuffer! %s",
00361                                  strerror(errno));
00362         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00363     }
00364 
00365     evbuffer_add_printf(buf, "%s %s%s%s%s HTTP/%d.%d\r\n",
00366                         htparser_get_methodstr(upstream_req->conn->parser),
00367                         request->rule->regex_to,
00368                         upstream_req->uri->path->match_end,
00369                         *query_args ? "?" : "", query_args,
00370                         htparser_get_major(upstream_req->conn->parser),
00371                         htparser_get_minor(upstream_req->conn->parser));
00372 
00373     evhtp_headers_for_each(hdrs, write_header_to_evbuffer, buf);
00374 
00375     evbuffer_add(buf, "\r\n", 2);
00376     bufferevent_write_buffer(request->downstream_conn->connection, buf);
00377     evbuffer_free(buf);
00378 
00379     return EVHTP_RES_OK;
00380 } /* send_upstream_headers */
00381 
00382 evhtp_res
00383 send_upstream_body(evhtp_request_t * upstream_req, evbuf_t * buf, void * arg) {
00384     /* stream upstream request body to the downstream server */
00385     request_t      * request;
00386     rproxy_t       * rproxy;
00387     downstream_c_t * ds_conn;
00388 
00389     request = arg;
00390     assert(request != NULL);
00391 
00392     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00393     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00394 
00395     if (!upstream_req || !buf) {
00396         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00397                                  "[ERROR] send_upstream_body() upstream_req = %p, buf = %p", upstream_req, buf);
00398         return EVHTP_RES_FATAL;
00399     }
00400 
00401     if (!(ds_conn = request->downstream_conn)) {
00402         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00403                                  "[ERROR] send_upstream_body() downstream_conn == NULL");
00404         return EVHTP_RES_FATAL;
00405     }
00406 
00407     if (!ds_conn->connection || request->error > 0) {
00408         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00409                                  "[ERROR] send_upstream_body() conn->connection = %p, request->error == %d",
00410                                  ds_conn->connection, request->error);
00411         evbuffer_drain(buf, -1);
00412 
00413         return EVHTP_RES_ERROR;
00414     }
00415 
00416     bufferevent_write_buffer(ds_conn->connection, buf);
00417 
00418     if (ds_conn->parent->config->high_watermark > 0) {
00419         if (evbuffer_get_length(bufferevent_get_output(ds_conn->connection)) >= ds_conn->parent->config->high_watermark) {
00420             request->hit_highwm = 1;
00421 #ifdef RPROXY_DEBUG
00422             printf("Hit high-watermark %zu: %zu in output\n",
00423                    ds_conn->parent->config->high_watermark,
00424                    evbuffer_get_length(bufferevent_get_output(ds_conn->connection)));
00425 #endif
00426             evhtp_request_pause(upstream_req);
00427             return EVHTP_RES_PAUSE;
00428         }
00429     }
00430 
00431     return EVHTP_RES_OK;
00432 } /* send_upstream_body */
00433 
00434 evhtp_res
00435 send_upstream_new_chunk(evhtp_request_t * upstream_req, uint64_t len, void * arg) {
00436     request_t      * request;
00437     rproxy_t       * rproxy;
00438     downstream_c_t * ds_conn;
00439 
00440     request = arg;
00441     assert(request != NULL);
00442 
00443     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00444     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00445 
00446     if (!upstream_req) {
00447         logger_log_error(rproxy->logger,
00448                          "[ERROR] send_upstream_new_chunk() upstream_req == NULL");
00449         return EVHTP_RES_FATAL;
00450     }
00451 
00452     if (!(ds_conn = request->downstream_conn)) {
00453         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00454                                  "[ERROR] send_upstream_new_chunk() request->downstream_conn == NULL");
00455         return EVHTP_RES_FATAL;
00456     }
00457 
00458     if (!ds_conn->connection || request->error > 0) {
00459         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00460                                  "[ERROR] send_upstream_new_chunk() conn->connection = %p, request->error = %d",
00461                                  ds_conn->connection, request->error);
00462         return EVHTP_RES_ERROR;
00463     }
00464 
00465     evbuffer_add_printf(bufferevent_get_output(ds_conn->connection),
00466                         "%x\r\n", (unsigned int)len);
00467 
00468     return EVHTP_RES_OK;
00469 }
00470 
00471 evhtp_res
00472 send_upstream_chunk_done(evhtp_request_t * upstream_req, void * arg) {
00473     request_t      * request;
00474     rproxy_t       * rproxy;
00475     downstream_c_t * ds_conn;
00476 
00477     assert(arg != NULL);
00478 
00479     request = arg;
00480     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00481     ds_conn = request->downstream_conn;
00482 
00483     if (!ds_conn->connection || request->error > 0) {
00484         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00485                                  "[ERROR] send_upstream_chunk_done() conn->connection = %p, request->error = %d",
00486                                  ds_conn->connection, request->error);
00487         return EVHTP_RES_ERROR;
00488     }
00489 
00490     bufferevent_write(ds_conn->connection, "\r\n", 2);
00491     return EVHTP_RES_OK;
00492 }
00493 
00494 evhtp_res
00495 send_upstream_chunks_done(evhtp_request_t * upstream_req, void * arg) {
00496     request_t      * request;
00497     rproxy_t       * rproxy;
00498     downstream_c_t * ds_conn;
00499 
00500     assert(arg != NULL);
00501 
00502     request = arg;
00503     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00504     ds_conn = request->downstream_conn;
00505 
00506     if (!ds_conn->connection || request->error > 0) {
00507         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00508                                  "[ERROR] send_upstream_chunks_done() conn->connection = %p, request->error = %d",
00509                                  ds_conn->connection, request->error);
00510         return EVHTP_RES_ERROR;
00511     }
00512 
00513     bufferevent_write(ds_conn->connection, "0\r\n\r\n", 5);
00514     return EVHTP_RES_OK;
00515 }
00516 
00517 evhtp_res
00518 upstream_fini(evhtp_request_t * upstream_req, void * arg) {
00519     request_t      * request;
00520     rproxy_t       * rproxy;
00521     downstream_c_t * ds_conn;
00522     downstream_t   * downstream;
00523     int              res;
00524 
00525     assert(arg != NULL);
00526 
00527     request = arg;
00528     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00529     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00530 
00531     /* if this downstream request is still pending, remove it from the queue */
00532     if (request->pending) {
00533         TAILQ_REMOVE(&rproxy->pending, request, next);
00534         rproxy->n_pending -= 1;
00535         request_free(request);
00536         return EVHTP_RES_OK;
00537     }
00538 
00539     ds_conn = request->downstream_conn;
00540     assert(ds_conn != NULL);
00541 
00542     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00543         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request, "[CRIT] we should never get here!");
00544         downstream_connection_set_down(ds_conn);
00545     } else {
00546         downstream_connection_set_idle(ds_conn);
00547     }
00548 
00549     request_free(request);
00550 
00551     return EVHTP_RES_OK;
00552 } /* upstream_fini */
00553 
00560 static void
00561 upstream_error(evhtp_request_t * upstream_req, short events, void * arg) {
00562     request_t      * request;
00563     rproxy_t       * rproxy;
00564     downstream_c_t * ds_conn;
00565 
00566     request = arg;
00567     assert(request != NULL);
00568 
00569     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00570     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00571 
00572     evhtp_unset_all_hooks(&upstream_req->hooks);
00573 
00574     logger_log_error(rproxy->logger, "[WARN] client aborted error = %x", events);
00575 
00576     if (request->pending) {
00577         /* upstream encountered socket error while still in a pending state */
00578         assert(request->downstream_conn == NULL);
00579 
00580         TAILQ_REMOVE(&rproxy->pending, request, next);
00581         rproxy->n_pending -= 1;
00582         request_free(request);
00583         return;
00584     }
00585 
00586     request->upstream_err = 1;
00587 
00588     ds_conn = request->downstream_conn;
00589     assert(ds_conn != NULL);
00590 
00591     if (!request->reading) {
00592         /* since we are not currently dealing with data being parsed by
00593          * downstream_connection_readcb, we must do all the resource cleanup
00594          * here.
00595          */
00596 
00597         if (request->done) {
00598             /* the request was completely finished, so we can safely set the
00599              * downstream as idle.
00600              */
00601             logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00602                                      "[WARN] request completed, client aborted");
00603             downstream_connection_set_idle(ds_conn);
00604         } else {
00605             /* request never completed, set the connection to down */
00606             logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00607                                      "[WARN] request incomplete, client aborted");
00608             downstream_connection_set_down(ds_conn);
00609         }
00610 
00611         request_free(request);
00612     }
00613 } /* upstream_error */
00614 
00623 static void
00624 downstream_pending_timeout(evutil_socket_t fd, short what, void * arg) {
00625     request_t       * ds_req;
00626     rproxy_t        * rproxy;
00627     evhtp_request_t * up_req;
00628 
00629     ds_req = arg;
00630     assert(ds_req != NULL);
00631 
00632     rproxy = ds_req->rproxy;
00633     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00634 
00635     up_req = ds_req->upstream_request;
00636     assert(up_req != NULL);
00637 
00638     /* unset all hooks except for the fini, evhtp_send_reply() will call the
00639      * fini function after the 503 message has been delivered */
00640     evhtp_unset_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_headers);
00641     evhtp_unset_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_new_chunk);
00642     evhtp_unset_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_chunk_complete);
00643     evhtp_unset_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_chunks_complete);
00644     evhtp_unset_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_read);
00645     evhtp_unset_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_error);
00646 
00647     up_req->keepalive = 0;
00648 
00649     evhtp_headers_add_header(up_req->headers_out, evhtp_header_new("Connection", "close", 0, 0));
00650     evhtp_send_reply(up_req, 503);
00651 }
00652 
00663 evhtp_res
00664 upstream_pre_accept(evhtp_connection_t * up_conn, void * arg) {
00665     rproxy_t * rproxy;
00666 
00667     if (!(rproxy = evthr_get_aux(up_conn->thread))) {
00668         return EVHTP_RES_FATAL;
00669     }
00670 
00671     if (rproxy->server_cfg->max_pending <= 0) {
00672         /* configured with unlimited pending */
00673         return EVHTP_RES_OK;
00674     }
00675 
00676     /* check to see if we have too many pending requests, and if so, drop this
00677      * connection.
00678      */
00679     if ((rproxy->n_pending + 1) > rproxy->server_cfg->max_pending) {
00680 #ifdef RPROXY_DEBUG
00681         printf("Dropped connection, too many pending requests\n");
00682 #endif
00683         return EVHTP_RES_ERROR;
00684     }
00685 
00686     return EVHTP_RES_OK;
00687 }
00688 
00689 evhtp_res
00690 upstream_request_start(evhtp_request_t * up_req, evhtp_path_t * path, void * arg) {
00691     /* this function is called whenever evhtp has parsed up to the PATH of a
00692      * request.
00693      *
00694      * Once the downstream request has been initialized and all data is setup,
00695      * this function will not immediately process the request since a downstream
00696      * connection may not be available at the time the upstream request was
00697      * made. Instead the request is placed in a pending request queue that is
00698      * signaled to process every time a downstream connection is set to idle
00699      * (via downstream_connection_set_idle()).
00700      *
00701      * The return value of this is EVHTP_RES_PAUSE which informs the evhtp
00702      * backend to suspend reading of data on the upstreams socket until the
00703      * process_pending function successfully finds an idle downstream
00704      * connection.
00705      *
00706      * TL;DNR: upstream request is not immediately processed but placed in
00707      *         pending queue until downstream connection becomes available.
00708      */
00709     rule_t    * rule   = NULL;
00710     rproxy_t  * rproxy = NULL;
00711     request_t * ds_req = NULL;
00712 
00713     /* the rproxy structure is contained within the evthr's aux var */
00714     if (!(rproxy = evthr_get_aux(up_req->conn->thread))) {
00715         return EVHTP_RES_FATAL;
00716     }
00717 
00718     if (!(rule = arg)) {
00719         logger_log_error(rproxy->logger,
00720                          "[ERROR] upstream_request_start() arg == NULL");
00721         return EVHTP_RES_FATAL;
00722     }
00723 
00724     /* initialize the downstream request */
00725     if (!(ds_req = request_new(rproxy))) {
00726         logger_log_error(rproxy->logger, "[CRIT] Could not create new request! %s",
00727                          strerror(errno));
00728         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00729     }
00730 
00731     /* set the upstream request */
00732     ds_req->upstream_request = up_req;
00733 
00734     /* set the request as pending */
00735     ds_req->pending          = 1;
00736     rproxy->n_pending       += 1;
00737 
00738     /* set the requests matched rule */
00739     ds_req->rule = rule;
00740 
00741     if (rproxy->server_cfg->pending_timeout) {
00742         struct timeval stagger_tv = { 0 };
00743         struct timeval tv;
00744 
00745         ds_req->pending_ev = evtimer_new(rproxy->evbase, downstream_pending_timeout, ds_req);
00746 
00747         /* in order to avoid bursts of pending timers which can cause
00748          * degregation based on the number of timers, we use the cached
00749          * event_base's timeval->tv_usec to stagger the pending timer
00750          * execution.
00751          */
00752 
00753         event_base_gettimeofday_cached(rproxy->evbase, &stagger_tv);
00754 
00755         /* we don't really want to go go over half a second */
00756         stagger_tv.tv_usec = stagger_tv.tv_usec % 5000;
00757 
00758 
00759         tv.tv_sec          = rproxy->server_cfg->pending_timeout;
00760         tv.tv_usec         = stagger_tv.tv_usec;
00761 
00762         evtimer_add(ds_req->pending_ev, &tv);
00763     }
00764 
00765     /* Since this is called after a regex match, we set upstream request
00766      * specific evhtp hooks specific to this request. This is done in order
00767      * to stream the upstream data directly to the downstream and allow for
00768      * the modification of the request made to the downstream.
00769      */
00770 
00771     /* call this function once all headers from the upstream have been parsed */
00772     evhtp_set_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_headers,
00773                    send_upstream_headers, ds_req);
00774 
00775     evhtp_set_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_new_chunk,
00776                    send_upstream_new_chunk, ds_req);
00777 
00778     evhtp_set_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_chunk_complete,
00779                    send_upstream_chunk_done, ds_req);
00780 
00781     evhtp_set_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_chunks_complete,
00782                    send_upstream_chunks_done, ds_req);
00783 
00784     /* call this function if the upstream request contains a body */
00785     evhtp_set_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_read,
00786                    send_upstream_body, ds_req);
00787 
00788     /* call this function after the upstream request has been marked as complete
00789      */
00790     evhtp_set_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_request_fini,
00791                    upstream_fini, ds_req);
00792 
00793     /* call this function if the upstream request encounters a socket error */
00794     evhtp_set_hook(&up_req->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_error,
00795                    upstream_error, ds_req);
00796 
00797     /* insert this request into our pending queue and signal processor event */
00798     TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&rproxy->pending, ds_req, next);
00799     event_active(rproxy->request_ev, EV_WRITE, 1);
00800 
00801     /* tell evhtp to stop reading from the upstream */
00802     return EVHTP_RES_PAUSE;
00803 }     /* upstream_request_start */
00804 
00805 void
00806 rproxy_process_pending(int fd, short which, void * arg) {
00807     rproxy_t  * rproxy;
00808     request_t * request;
00809     request_t * save;
00810     int         res;
00811 
00812 
00813     rproxy  = arg;
00814     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00815 
00816     request = NULL;
00817     save    = NULL;
00818 
00819     for (request = TAILQ_FIRST(&rproxy->pending); request; request = save) {
00820         save = TAILQ_NEXT(request, next);
00821 
00822         if (!(request->downstream_conn = downstream_connection_get(rproxy))) {
00823             /* no idle connections available */
00824             break;
00825         }
00826 
00827         res = downstream_connection_set_active(request->downstream_conn);
00828         assert(res >= 0);
00829 
00830         /* remove this request from the pending queue */
00831         TAILQ_REMOVE(&rproxy->pending, request, next);
00832 
00833         request->downstream_conn->request = request;
00834         request->pending   = 0;
00835         rproxy->n_pending -= 1;
00836 
00837         if (request->pending_ev != NULL) {
00838             /* delete the pending request timer, if configured */
00839             evtimer_del(request->pending_ev);
00840         }
00841 
00842 
00843         /* since the upstream request processing has been paused, we must
00844          * unpause to process the request */
00845         evhtp_request_resume(request->upstream_request);
00846     }
00847 } /* rproxy_process_pending */
00848 
00857 void
00858 rproxy_thread_init(evhtp_t * htp, evthr_t * thr, void * arg) {
00859     evbase_t         * evbase;
00860     rproxy_t         * rproxy;
00861     downstream_t     * downstream;
00862     server_cfg_t     * server_cfg;
00863     downstream_cfg_t * ds_cfg;
00864 
00865 
00866     server_cfg = arg;
00867     assert(server_cfg != NULL);
00868 
00869     evbase     = evthr_get_base(thr);
00870     assert(evbase != NULL);
00871 
00872     if (!(rproxy = calloc(sizeof(rproxy_t), 1))) {
00873         fprintf(stderr, "Could not malloc: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00874         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00875     }
00876 
00877     TAILQ_INIT(&rproxy->downstreams);
00878     TAILQ_INIT(&rproxy->pending);
00879 
00880     rproxy->server_cfg = server_cfg;
00881     rproxy->logger     = logger_init(server_cfg->logger);
00882     rproxy->evbase     = evbase;
00883 
00884     if (rproxy->logger) {
00885         logger_open(rproxy->logger);
00886     }
00887 
00888     /* create a downstream instance for each configured downstream */
00889     TAILQ_FOREACH(ds_cfg, &server_cfg->downstreams, next) {
00890         downstream_t * downstream;
00891 
00892         if (!(downstream = downstream_new(rproxy, ds_cfg))) {
00893             logger_log_error(rproxy->logger,
00894                              "[CRIT] Could not create new downstream! %s",
00895                              strerror(errno));
00896             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00897         }
00898 
00899         TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&rproxy->downstreams, downstream, next);
00900     }
00901 
00902     /* enable the pending request processing event */
00903     rproxy->request_ev = event_new(evbase, -1, EV_READ | EV_PERSIST,
00904                                    rproxy_process_pending, rproxy);
00905 
00906     /* set this threads aux data arguments to the rproxy_t structure */
00907     evthr_set_aux(thr, rproxy);
00908 
00909     /* startup all of our downstream connections */
00910     TAILQ_FOREACH(downstream, &rproxy->downstreams, next) {
00911         if (downstream_connection_init(evbase, downstream) < 0) {
00912             logger_log_error(rproxy->logger,
00913                              "[CRIT] Could not init downstream conn! %s",
00914                              strerror(errno));
00915             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00916         }
00917     }
00918 } /* rproxy_thread_init */
00919 
00920 int
00921 rproxy_init(evbase_t * evbase, rproxy_cfg_t * cfg) {
00922     server_cfg_t * server;
00923 
00924     TAILQ_FOREACH(server, &cfg->servers, next) {
00925         downstream_cfg_t * ds_cfg;
00926         rewrite_cfg_t    * rw_cfg;
00927         evhtp_t          * htp;
00928 
00929         if (!(htp = evhtp_new(evbase, NULL))) {
00930             return -1;
00931         }
00932 
00933         /* create a pre-accept callback which will disconnect the client
00934          * immediately if the max pending request queue is over the limit.
00935          */
00936 
00937         evhtp_set_pre_accept_cb(htp, upstream_pre_accept, NULL);
00938 
00939         /* for each rewrite, create a rule which is used to create
00940          * a regex based evhtp callback */
00941         TAILQ_FOREACH(rw_cfg, &server->rewrites, next) {
00942             evhtp_callback_t * cb = NULL;
00943             rule_t           * rule;
00944 
00945             if (!(rule = calloc(sizeof(rule_t), 1))) {
00946                 return -1;
00947             }
00948 
00949             /*
00950              * convert the rewrite_cfg_t to a rule_t structure
00951              * rule->rproxy     = rproxy;
00952              */
00953             rule->regex_from = strdup(rw_cfg->src);
00954             rule->regex_to   = strdup(rw_cfg->dst);
00955 
00956             cb = evhtp_set_regex_cb(htp, rule->regex_from, NULL, rule);
00957 
00958             /* if a path matches the regex pattern, upstream_request_start will
00959              * be called with the argument of this rule_t
00960              */
00961             evhtp_set_hook(&cb->hooks, evhtp_hook_on_path,
00962                            upstream_request_start, rule);
00963         }
00964 
00965         if (server->ssl) {
00966             /* enable SSL support on the evhtp structure */
00967             evhtp_ssl_init(htp, server->ssl);
00968         }
00969 
00970         /* if configured, set our upstream read/write timeouts */
00971         if (server->read_timeout || server->write_timeout) {
00972             struct timeval tv_r = {
00973                 .tv_sec  = server->read_timeout,
00974                 .tv_usec = 0
00975             };
00976 
00977             struct timeval tv_w = {
00978                 .tv_sec  = server->write_timeout,
00979                 .tv_usec = 0
00980             };
00981 
00982             evhtp_set_timeouts(htp,
00983                                server->read_timeout ? &tv_r : NULL,
00984                                server->write_timeout ? &tv_w : NULL);
00985         }
00986 
00987         /* use a worker thread pool for connections, and for each
00988          * thread that is initialized call the rproxy_thread_init
00989          * function. rproxy_thread_init will create a new rproxy_t
00990          * instance for each of the threads
00991          */
00992         evhtp_use_threads(htp, rproxy_thread_init,
00993                           server->num_threads, server);
00994 
00995         if (evhtp_bind_socket(htp,
00996                               server->bind_addr,
00997                               server->bind_port,
00998                               server->backlog) < 0) {
00999             fprintf(stderr, "[ERROR] unable to bind to %s:%d (%s)\n",
01000                     server->bind_addr,
01001                     server->bind_port,
01002                     strerror(errno));
01003             exit(-1);
01004         }
01005     }
01006 
01007     return 0;
01008 }     /* rproxy_init */
01009 
01010 static void
01011 rproxy_dropperms(const char * user, const char * group) {
01012     if (group) {
01013         struct group * grp;
01014 
01015         if (!(grp = getgrnam(group))) {
01016             fprintf(stderr, "No such group '%s'\n", group);
01017             exit(1);
01018         }
01019 
01020         if (setgid(grp->gr_gid) != 0) {
01021             fprintf(stderr, "Could not grp perm to '%s' (%s)\n",
01022                     group, strerror(errno));
01023             exit(1);
01024         }
01025     }
01026 
01027     if (user) {
01028         struct passwd * usr;
01029 
01030         if (!(usr = getpwnam(user))) {
01031             fprintf(stderr, "No such user '%s'\n", user);
01032             exit(1);
01033         }
01034 
01035         if (seteuid(usr->pw_uid) != 0) {
01036             fprintf(stderr, "Could not usr perm to '%s' (%s)\n",
01037                     user, strerror(errno));
01038             exit(1);
01039         }
01040     }
01041 }
01042 
01043 int
01044 rproxy_daemonize(char * root, int noclose) {
01045     int fd;
01046 
01047     switch (fork()) {
01048         case -1:
01049             return -1;
01050         case 0:
01051             break;
01052         default:
01053             exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
01054     }
01055 
01056     if (setsid() == -1) {
01057         return -1;
01058     }
01059 
01060     if (root == 0) {
01061         if (chdir(root) != 0) {
01062             perror("chdir");
01063             return -1;
01064         }
01065     }
01066 
01067     if (noclose == 0 && (fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0)) != -1) {
01068         if (dup2(fd, STDIN_FILENO) < 0) {
01069             perror("dup2 stdin");
01070             return -1;
01071         }
01072         if (dup2(fd, STDOUT_FILENO) < 0) {
01073             perror("dup2 stdout");
01074             return -1;
01075         }
01076         if (dup2(fd, STDERR_FILENO) < 0) {
01077             perror("dup2 stderr");
01078             return -1;
01079         }
01080 
01081         if (fd > STDERR_FILENO) {
01082             if (close(fd) < 0) {
01083                 perror("close");
01084                 return -1;
01085             }
01086         }
01087     }
01088     return 0;
01089 } /* daemonize */
01090 
01091 int
01092 rproxy_set_rlimits(int nofiles) {
01093 #ifndef NO_RLIMITS
01094     struct rlimit limit;
01095     rlim_t        max_nofiles;
01096 
01097     if (nofiles <= 0) {
01098         return -1;
01099     }
01100 
01101     if (getrlimit(RLIMIT_NOFILE, &limit) == -1) {
01102         fprintf(stderr, "Could not obtain curr NOFILE lim: %s\n", strerror(errno));
01103         return -1;
01104     }
01105 
01106     if (nofiles > limit.rlim_max) {
01107         fprintf(stderr, "Unable to set curr NOFILE (requested=%d, sys-limit=%d)\n",
01108                 (int)nofiles, (int)limit.rlim_max);
01109         fprintf(stderr, "Please make sure your systems limits.conf is set high enough (usually in /etc/security/limits.conf!\n");
01110         return -1;
01111     }
01112 
01113     if (nofiles < 10000) {
01114         fprintf(stderr, "WARNING: %d max-nofiles is very small, this could be bad, lets check...\n", nofiles);
01115 
01116         if (limit.rlim_max >= 10000) {
01117             fprintf(stderr, "INFO: using %d (your hard-limit) on max-nofiles instead of %d!\n", (int)limit.rlim_max, nofiles);
01118             nofiles = limit.rlim_max;
01119         } else {
01120             fprintf(stderr, "WARN: nope, can't go any higher, you may want to fix this...\n");
01121         }
01122     }
01123 
01124     limit.rlim_cur = nofiles;
01125 
01126     if (setrlimit(RLIMIT_NOFILE, &limit) == -1) {
01127         fprintf(stderr, "Could not set NOFILE lim: %s\n", strerror(errno));
01128         return -1;
01129     }
01130 
01131 #endif
01132     return 0;
01133 } /* rproxy_set_rlimits */
01134 
01135 int
01136 main(int argc, char ** argv) {
01137     rproxy_cfg_t * rproxy_cfg;
01138     evbase_t     * evbase;
01139 
01140     if (argc < 2) {
01141         printf("RProxy Version: %s (Libevhtp Version: %s, Libevent Version: %s, OpenSSL Version: %s)\n",
01142                RPROXY_VERSION, EVHTP_VERSION, event_get_version(), SSLeay_version(SSLEAY_VERSION));
01143         fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s <config>\n", argv[0]);
01144         return -1;
01145     }
01146 
01147     if (!(rproxy_cfg = rproxy_cfg_parse_file(argv[1]))) {
01148         fprintf(stderr, "Error parsing file %s\n", argv[1]);
01149         return -1;
01150     }
01151 
01152 #ifdef USE_MALLOPT
01153     if (rproxy_cfg->mem_trimsz) {
01154         mallopt(M_TRIM_THRESHOLD, rproxy_cfg->mem_trimsz);
01155     }
01156 #endif
01157 
01158     if (rproxy_set_rlimits(rproxy_cfg->max_nofile) < 0) {
01159         exit(-1);
01160     }
01161 
01162     if (rproxy_cfg->daemonize == true) {
01163         if (rproxy_daemonize(rproxy_cfg->rootdir, 1) < 0) {
01164             exit(-1);
01165         }
01166     }
01167 
01168     if (!(evbase = event_base_new())) {
01169         fprintf(stderr, "Error creating event_base: %s\n", strerror(errno));
01170         rproxy_cfg_free(rproxy_cfg);
01171         return -1;
01172     }
01173 
01174     rproxy_init(evbase, rproxy_cfg);
01175 
01176     if (rproxy_cfg->user || rproxy_cfg->group) {
01177         rproxy_dropperms(rproxy_cfg->user, rproxy_cfg->group);
01178     }
01179 
01180     event_base_loop(evbase, 0);
01181 
01182     return 0;
01183 } /* main */
